main.name: Harrison Kim
main.bio: Hi there! I am Harrison! I use to run the Shanghai chapter of Le Wagon, a 9-week intensive coding bootcamp that has chapters in 40 different cities around the world. I love to empower people and improve people's lives. At the intersection of design, technology and sustainability, I aim to build products or services that improve people's physical health, mental health as well as environment's health.
main.contactmessage: Currently building an interntational community of professionals based in Taiwan on Line group chat. I plan to build a digital nomad paradise in Taitung, on the east coast of Taiwan. If you're interested in Taiwan in any way, hit me up!

education.description: Double Major in Architecture and Economics

work.title: Founder
work.description: Creating a nomad paradise destination for remote workers, backpackers and aspiring remote workers.

testimonials.text: The man, the myth, the legend. Logistics is a thankless job and when done well, you don't see it. Everything in the camp, from start to finish, was executed without any noticeable issues from the students. Awesome job.

Harrison is the bomb! I really appreciated Harrison's help in the second week - he really caught me in time and refused to let me go home in terrible spirits! He also discussed with me in how I could manage myself better in the course and it made all the difference. Thank you so much for your insights and discussions Harrison, I don't think I could have made it through without that chat that night!!!!

Always a pleasure to talk to and work with! Harrison genuinely cares about the students and has the talent to give constructive, unbiased feedback about projects and other things in general. His optimism and sincerity made it very easy for me to open up and discuss about things or ask for help!!
